text: Pistius truncatus is a species of crab spiders belonging to the family Thomisidae.BiolibNorman I. Adults can be found from May to June.British Spiders ==Distribution and habitat== This species has a palaearctic distribution. It is widespread in central and western Europe.Fauna europaea It occurs in bushes, mainly in small scrubby oaks and in forest edges. == References == Category:Crab spiders of Europe Category:Thomisidae Category:Spiders described in 1772 Category:Palearctic spiders
